_comment: Example state file showing a mid-interview snapshot
title: User Onboarding Experience Research
context: Understanding how new users experience our product onboarding flow, identifying friction points, and discovering opportunities for improvement.

questions.base_question_text: Can you walk me through your first experience using our product? What do you remember about getting started?
questions.research_objective: Understand the user's initial impressions and emotional journey during onboarding

exchanges.question_text: Can you walk me through your first experience using our product? What do you remember about getting started?
exchanges.user_response: Yeah, I signed up last month. The signup was pretty easy, just email and password. But then I got to this dashboard and honestly had no idea what to do next. There were so many options.

insights_extracted: Dashboard overwhelm is a pain point
User felt lost after signup - no clear next action
response_analysis.recommendation_reason: User mentioned feeling lost - need to understand what would have helped

exchanges.question_text: You mentioned feeling overwhelmed by the dashboard. What would have helped you feel more confident about what to do next?
exchanges.user_response: I think if there was like a 'start here' button or maybe a quick tutorial. I ended up just clicking around randomly until something made sense. Took me like 20 minutes to figure out how to create my first project.

insights_extracted: Users want guided first action ('start here' CTA)
Current discovery time is ~20 minutes for first project
Users resort to random exploration without guidance
response_analysis.recommendation_reason: Clear understanding of initial experience and improvement opportunities - research objective fully satisfied

questions.transition_message: That's really helpful to understand your first experience. It sounds like that initial moment after signup was a key friction point. Let me ask you about something related...
cumulative_insights: Dashboard overwhelm is a pain point
User felt lost after signup - no clear next action
Users want guided first action ('start here' CTA)
Current discovery time is ~20 minutes for first project
Users resort to random exploration without guidance

questions.base_question_text: What features did you find most valuable once you got oriented? What made them stand out?
questions.research_objective: Identify high-value features and understand why they resonate with users

exchanges.question_text: What features did you find most valuable once you got oriented? What made them stand out?
exchanges.user_response: The collaboration feature is amazing. Being able to share projects with my team and see their edits in real-time - that's what made me stick with the product. Before this, we were emailing files back and forth.

insights_extracted: Real-time collaboration is the key value driver
response_analysis.recommendation_reason: User identified one feature - probe for others and deeper understanding of why collaboration specifically

exchanges.question_text: The collaboration aspect really resonates. Beyond the real-time editing, were there any other features that surprised you or exceeded your expectations?

cumulative_insights: Real-time collaboration is the key value driver

questions.base_question_text: Have you encountered any frustrations or limitations while using the product?
questions.research_objective: Identify pain points and areas for product improvement

insights.content: Dashboard overwhelm causes user paralysis after signup
Users want a clear 'start here' CTA or guided first action
First project creation takes ~20 minutes without guidance
Real-time collaboration is the primary retention driver
Product replaces email-based file sharing workflows

conversation_history.content: Can you walk me through your first experience using our product? What do you remember about getting started?
Yeah, I signed up last month. The signup was pretty easy, just email and password. But then I got to this dashboard and honestly had no idea what to do next. There were so many options.
You mentioned feeling overwhelmed by the dashboard. What would have helped you feel more confident about what to do next?

I think if there was like a 'start here' button or maybe a quick tutorial. I ended up just clicking around randomly until something made sense. Took me like 20 minutes to figure out how to create my first project.

That's really helpful to understand your first experience. It sounds like that initial moment after signup was a key friction point. Let me ask you about something related... What features did you find most valuable once you got oriented? What made them stand out?

The collaboration feature is amazing. Being able to share projects with my team and see their edits in real-time - that's what made me stick with the product. Before this, we were emailing files back and forth.
The collaboration aspect really resonates. Beyond the real-time editing, were there any other features that surprised you or exceeded your expectations?
